channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Before traffic light in bike box on Malden Road, 27th January
item.description:
Major disintegration of roadway leading to gravel on both sides and in junction and potential damage to vehicles. Also somewhat dangerous to cyclists. Needs resurfacing in this section and repainting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Malden Crescent, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SORN vehicle parked on public road, 27th January
item.description:
Vehicle shown on Gov Check Tax site with a SORN. But it parked on a public road which is not allowed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crooke Road, New Cross, Greater London

item.title: Pothole, 27th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Verdant Lane, Downham, Greater London

item.title: No access for wheelchair user, 27th January
item.description:
The binmen left this cooker where it is today, previously it was in the bin shed. I am a wheelchair user and I now am unable to go out!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Phillipp Street, Hackney, London

item.title: General litter in the area could we have more bins please, 27th January
item.description:

item.title: Uncollected rubbish, 27th January
item.description:
The rubbish at Tudor Court, Well Hall Road, SE9 6SY has not been collected for over a month. It appears that the residents are not concerned about the mess in the surrounding area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Hall Road, Eltham

item.title: Mounds of leaves to be taken, 27th January
item.description:
There were four large mounds of leaves that were swept but left. I reported them to be taken away as it has been a while now and thankfully two were taken, it was reported as completed but the other two remain. These are from the maple tree above and they also should be trimmed to prevent any further lifting of the pavement and also excess leaf issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Mickleham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various types of rubbish littering the bank on station road next to house boundaries, 27th January
item.description:
There has been a long standing problem of a large amount of litter that has accumulated on the bank leading up to the station. There are larger items including bikes there too, stuck behind the fence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Millfields Close, Poverest, Greater London
